intro: Lophiaris bicallosa, commonly known as the two-spined lophiaris, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically from November to February. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lophiaris bicallosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
